gaia::text::TextWatcher Class Reference

Private Member Functions

 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (TextWatcher)

Detailed Description

When an object of a type is attached to an Editable, its methods will be called when the text is changed. 

 // customization TextWatcher
 class CustomTextWatcher : public gaia::text::TextWatcher {
   public:
     CustomTextWatcher() {
     };

     virtual ~CustomTextWatcher() {
     };

     void beforeTextChanged(const gaia::base::CharSequence* s, int32_t start, int32_t count, int32_t after) {
     };

     void onTextChanged(const gaia::base::CharSequence* s, int32_t start, int32_t before, int32_t count) {
     };

     void afterTextChanged(const gaia::text::Editable* s) {
     };
 };

 // create and setting TextWatcher
 CustomTextWatcher* watcher = new CustomTextWatcher();
 TextWidget* tv = new TextWidget(static_cast<Page*>(this));
 tv->addTextChangedListener(watcher);

Definition at line 52 of file TextWatcher.h.

virtual gaia::text::TextWatcher::~TextWatcher ( ) [virtual]

Member Function Documentation

virtual void gaia::text::TextWatcher::afterTextChanged ( const Editable *  s) [pure virtual]

This method is called to notify you that, somewhere within s, the text has been changed.

It is legitimate to make further changes to s from this callback, but be careful not to get yourself into an infinite loop, because any changes you make will cause this method to be called again recursively. (You are not told where the change took place because other afterTextChanged() methods may already have made other changes and invalidated the offsets. But if you need to know here, you can use Spannable#setSpan in onTextChanged to mark your place and then look up from here where the span ended up.

virtual void gaia::text::TextWatcher::beforeTextChanged ( const base::CharSequence *  s,
int32_t  start,
int32_t  count,
int32_t  after 
) [pure virtual]

This method is called to notify you that, within s, the count characters beginning at start are about to be replaced by new text with length after.

It is an error to attempt to make changes to s from this callback.

gaia::text::TextWatcher::DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN ( TextWatcher  ) [private]
virtual void gaia::text::TextWatcher::onTextChanged ( const base::CharSequence *  s,
int32_t  start,
int32_t  before,
int32_t  count 
) [pure virtual]

This method is called to notify you that, within s, the count characters beginning at start have just replaced old text that had length before.

It is an error to attempt to make changes to s from this callback.
